FuncDef:
The set single-pm output-power-limit command configures the output power limit for a single PM module.
The undo set single-pm output-power-limit command deletes the output power limit configured for a PM module.
By default, the output power of a single PM module equals the rated output power.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the output power limit, in watt.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 3300.

Specifies a chassis, which is represented in the form of chassis type+chassis ID.
The chassis ID is 1 or 2. A chassis example is CLC1 or CLC2.

Examples: Warning: This operation may cause power-on failures for newly inserted boards! Continue? [Y/N]:y
Info: Set power supply mode successfully.
Info: Set power supply mode successfully.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the external power supply of equipment room is insufficient, run the set single-pm output-power-limit command to configure the output power limit for a single PM module.
Precautions
For X8X16 models, this command is supported only on X8AX16A chassis.
